column4: hi guys, my new user isn't being asked for a password when I sudo, i'm in the sudo group... ideas?
is it too close to the initial login, so it's caching my pass? i thought sudo would still ask...
you mean not requiring password when you sudo su - <login> ?
he's using VMware in a windows 7 host and Ubuntu client vm. He wants his SD-card to be (auto-monted) in Ubuntu
you can't move trees using mv either ejv
mv some/very/long/path/to/file anotherdir  will not work
yes you can, I do it all the time. what version of the GNU toolchain are you using? lol
will it mv file to anotherdir/file or anotherdir/very/long/path/to/file  ?
he didn't, you can still see the command evocation
i'm trying lshw here... but it does not map controllers to the assigned /dev/sdX devices
we are not even sure if vmware is properly exposing the card, or HOW it is doing so
ohs: SD cards are pretty standard, regardless of manufacturer... it's all about the card READER, which are usually USB/PCI internally
nope, i'm a big fan of VirtualBox... never used vmware before
and not willing to since it looks so painful to set up ;)
